Mike Carter

An experienced full-stack developer and technical leader.

Me and my skills

I’ve worked in teams of many sizes, and have led the digital transformation of multiple businesses through 2 companies I’ve founded.

At heart I’m a creative engineer, designing and delivering high-performance platforms across web and mobile, with deep experience spanning backend API engineering, frontend engineering, light mobile engineering, cloud infrastructure, and systems integration:

  • Backend API engineering with Node.js/TypeScript and Ruby, MySQL/PostgreSQL, Redis.
  • Frontend engineering with React/TypeScript, SPA architecture, state management, and high-volume user flows.
  • Mobile engineering using React Native & Hotwire Native, including push notifications, authentication, and real-time messaging.
  • Cloud infrastructure, CI/CD, automated testing, monitoring, and scalability practices across distributed systems.
  • Systems integration with third-party providers including authentication services, payment platforms, and booking/channel manager APIs.

If you’d like to work with me, Email Me

Work history

I’ve been in tech for a while now, but here’s a summary of the last decade or so.

BitBrawn 2021 - Present

I founded BitBrawn, which builds and modernises the software that scaling SMEs rely on when off the shelf tools and spreadsheets can no longer keep up. We design, develop, and support custom web applications that remove operational friction, eliminate rigid workflows, and create the clarity teams need to grow with confidence. Every project is delivered by senior specialists and structured around fixed price milestones so outcomes stay predictable. Visit BitBrawn.

Recent work includes:

  • Supporting Laced as they expanded into European markets post Brexit with a platform built for scale.
  • Partnering with RIFT to digitise and streamline their Tax Refund claims process.
  • Helping Purplebricks increase customer self service through a new property information intake system.
  • Rebuilding DC Thomson’s subscription purchase platform using Next.js, Tailwind, and a custom headless CMS.
  • Leading modernisation and ongoing development for Allocate, improving their core web application and API.

Leaf 2016 - 2021

I founded Leaf, a digital product agency, with my designer partner Chris Annetts. We grew the team to seven and delivered high impact digital products for UK and US companies before closing the studio in 2021 to pursue new paths. Visit Leaf.

Highlights:

  • Improved Holiday Extras’ insurance quote journey for thousands of customers and supported the launch of their trip planning app, HEHA.
  • Led the digital transformation of RIFT, enabling hundreds of thousands of customers to self service their tax refund claims.
  • Built Laced’s digital platform from the ground up and helped them scale to handle hundreds of millions in transactions.
  • Pulled Allocate out of a technical debt crisis and put a sustainable, modern foundation in place.
  • Completed numerous smaller engagements with similar impact.

Holiday Extras 2013 - 2016

I joined Holiday Extras as a Web Developer in 2013, working primarily on their airport hotel and parking booking system.

During my employment I was promoted to Software Engineer, and then Software Architect, where I helped to technical decision making across the organisation. Visit Holiday Extras.

Products

I’ve built a few things over the years. Mostly side-projects, some more substantial.

IsThereSomebody 2023 - Now

I’m the technical co-founder on IsThereSomebody, a private, anonymous app that connects people who are supporting someone through addiction. It matches you with others in similar situations and lets you talk one-to-one through encrypted chat, share experiences in a small community space, and access curated resources when you need more structured help.

IsThereSomebody has 500+ active users and is growing steadily. Visit IsThereSomebody

Parable 2022 - 2023

Parable is an analytics platform for blog posts and articles. It tracks how many people actually read your content, and provides analytics useful to writers trying to grow an audience.

I built Parable in my free time over the course of a year, and launched it in 2022. It was a fun project to build, and I learned a lot about product development and marketing.

Unfortunately, Parable didn’t find product-market fit and I shut it down in 2023.

Howdy 2017 - 2022

Howdy was a simple tool that identifies contact forms on web pages and brings them to life, validating input and emailing submissions to the form owner.

Designed for the small businesses who just want a functional contact form. Howdy offered a cheap but effective solution to the problem of setting up contact forms. We developed it at Leaf in our spare time, and watched it organically grow to over 100 users before its eventual winding down in 2022.
